title: Ksiazka 1
txt: The mage Azyrion often meets with the knight Sonir on the castle's western tower, far from the rest of the Brotherhood. These conversations take place in complete solitude, at hours when no one should be listening.</br></br>I cannot determine the purpose of these meetings, but there is something in their tone and glances that unsettles me. Are they sharing knowledge, or are they perhaps plotting their own plans, of which no one else has any idea?

title: Ksiazka 2
txt: I cannot determine all the details, but I suspect it is nothing malicious. They were likely discussing the experiment in which a dead bear was transformed into a Nightmar. It seems to me that their conversation concerned the specifics of that ritual involving the summoning of the dead and how the potion affects dead bodies.

title: Ksiazka 3
txt: During the ritual meant to determine whether the Fire Devil possessed a soul, I noticed something disturbing. The mages who prepared the potion did not share its ingredients with the others. What they poured into the elixir was no longer the same as what was usually extracted from the tentacles. The substance had clearly changed thicker, foreign, as if infused with something none of us had ever known.</br></br>Unease grows. Even if we all pursue the same goal, not everyone is guided by the same understanding of the potion. Someone chose to make a hidden alteration, and the consequences of this action could be unpredictable.

title: Ksiazka 4
txt: I managed to observe the details of the ritual. On the left side of the bear's body, we place Hardened Bone, and on the right side  Necroplasma, extracted from the tentacles.</br></br>This arrangement seems crucial, affecting how the potion and the ritual interact with the dead body. Every element has its significance, and even the smallest change in the ingredients or their placement can have unpredictable consequences.

title: Ksiazka 5
txt: I observed the process of cutting tentacles  a dangerous task requiring full concentration. A knight undertaking this must be equipped with Might Rings, which increase the wearer/’s protection. If someone does not feel strong enough, it is best to also secure Stone Skin Amulets to minimize injuries from recoil and the harmful energies of the tentacle.</br></br>A mistake in movement equals the loss of life  the tentacles generate a powerful death field that instantly and mercilessly kills the unprepared. An averagely trained knight will not manage even with their own magical shield.</br></br>The ritual requires an enormous amount of life  life energy is needed for the tentacles to be effectively cut and prepared for further experiments.

title: Ksiazka 6
txt: Do not touch that substance! It is beautiful, shining like a sapphire in the torchlight, but it carries a curse. The mages fed it to fallen beasts, and they returned to life stronger, wilder than ever before. They say that it was then in Rookgaard that the first undead monsters appeared...

title: Ksiazka 7
txt: In the Grasslands, beneath the old stone slabs, lies an entrance that is marked on no map. Only a few know that it is not an ordinary tomb, but a crypt created by the same mages who studied the green slime. It is there that they conducted their most dangerous experiments.

title: Ksiazka 8
txt: As the bear returned to life, an older, terrifying beast emerged from the shadows. It was named Nightmare, a nightmare that filled the air with dread and foreshadowed impending destruction.

title: Ksiazka 9
txt: I am deeply puzzled as to why I was supposed to keep my mission hidden from Velquor. What could have been so important or dangerous that Azyrion did not want anyone in the Brotherhood to know the details?</br></br>Equally intriguing is why, as a reward for completing the task, I received such a powerful axe that emanates a strange, foreign energy. Its power far exceeds anything I have encountered before. Is it a reward, or perhaps a way to prepare me for something even greater? I cannot shake the feeling that there is more behind this gesture, something I do not yet understand.</br>S.

title: Ksiazka 11
txt: Some say that Rookgaard is only a prelude to a greater adventure... but we, who have remained here, know that this place has its secrets. On the island of Eldgard, beneath the old druid buildings, in the deepest tunnel, lies something that no one should awaken. I pray that the curious never find the right path.

title: Ksiazka 12
txt: A Fisherman's Tale</br></br>"One night I saw twinkling lights far out to sea. They were pirate sails, appearing suddenly. They vanished just as quickly, leaving behind only silence and the waves crashing against the shore-and fear in the hearts of those left ashore."

title: Ksiazka 13
txt: "The Pirates of Rookgaard"</br></br>"They say the waters around Rookgaard have long ceased to be the preserve of fishermen. The shadows of sails appear at night, and pirates rob unwary sailors. Old maps show where they hid treasures, but no one dared to search for them-for whoever approaches their bay may never return."

title: Ksiazka 14
txt: Eldgard, once a peaceful island of fishermen, became a place that attracted mages hungry for power. The volcanic rocks concealed fiery runes, older than mankind. It was here that a fragment of a spell was found-one that was meant to open a gate to hell itself.

title: Ksiazka 15
txt: On the surface, we still speak of a shared goal  the potion that restores life, though its ingredients come from plants and tentacles not of this world. Everyone repeats the same words, yet in the eyes of the brothers I see something different.</br></br>Not all of us are guided by the same purpose. Some seek knowledge, others dream of power, and still others wish to bring back one specific person. There are also those driven by a simple fear of death. The potion has become a mirror, reflecting our true desires.</br></br>I am beginning to understand that our unity is an illusion. Beneath the guise of a shared mission, each of us walks our own path, and the life-restoring potion becomes a tool for purposes no one dares speak aloud.

title: Ksiazka 16
txt: Page 1  "Shadow in the Mines"</br></br>"The old miners of Rookgaard spoke of a creature that inhabited the abandoned tunnels. They called it the Great Centipede. Its body twisted through the labyrinth of tunnels, and its every movement caused the earth to tremble and its jaws to clatter."

title: Ksiazka 17
txt: Page 1</br>"Shadey was a pirate without a conscience, plundering ships and settlements, and hiding his treasure in the cellars beneath his hut. When death finally came, he found no rest instead of a grave, he received a curse."

title: Ksiazka 18
txt: Page 5</br>"The Druids say that Shadey does not guard gold, but the curse itself - a prison he can never leave. Yet there are still those who seek a way into his lair... believing that where the spirit rests, the pirate’s treasure still lies."

title: Ksiazka 19
txt: Page 3</br>"The entrance to the tombs was long ago sealed. Yet whispers tell of a path from Eldgarde - flooded corridors leading straight to the caverns beneath the pirate’s hut."

title: Ksiazka 20
txt: Page 4</br>"Shadey knew the underground passages better than anyone. He used them to reach the Druids’ island and steal their herbs and treasures. It was they who cursed him and condemned him to eternal damnation, so he could never rest in the afterlife."

title: Ksiazka 21
txt: Page 2</br>"Beneath his hut lie the bodies of betrayed companions and victims. Some say that at night you can hear their wails, and in the windows of the abandoned hut, a flickering shadow appears. Whoever meets his eyes becomes trapped in the underground as a powerless spirit."

title: Ksiazka 22
txt: I witnessed the ritual. An ordinary wolf, which they had brought dead to the crypt, rose and roared so powerfully that stones fell from the ceiling.  They named this creature the Bonebeast. I fled before it noticed me. Even today, my hands tremble as I write these words.

title: Ksiazka 23
txt: They say the water near Eldgaard Island Lighthouse holds secrets older than the island itself. At night, it seems to whisper in your ear.

title: Ksiazka 24
txt: I was there when the circle ignited with a fire taller than the city walls. The ground split, and from the depths came a roar no human could withstand. I saw flaming claws and eyes like two molten lava pits. It was Infernus. I fled, but the fire caught up with me. My soul still burns to this day.

title: Ksiazka 25
txt: Note 1 - "Magic Strike"</br></br>"Exori Vis is a light blast of magic that projects energy forward. While it doesn't kill an enemy, it can repel beasts and buy them time to escape. On Rookgaard, anyone can master it - you don't need to be a mage to defend the island."

title: Ksiazka 26
txt: Note 1 - "Light Heal Friend"</br></br>"Exura Min Sio allows you to heal wounded friends. This spell isn't for everyone-only a select few can master it. They say you must earn the trust of the druids before they will teach you this art."

title: Ksiazka 27
txt: Page 1 - "The Birth of Eldgaard"</br></br>"Long ago, Eldgaard was just a lonely island amidst the waves. No one dared to settle there permanently, for the sea was stormy and the wind sang ominously among the rocks. But one day the druids arrived, seeking a place where they could rest from the world and shape the power of nature."

title: Ksiazka 28
txt: Page 3 - "Protection of the Island"</br></br>"It wasn’t just peace that attracted the druids-magic as well. The island held secrets that couldn’t be left unguarded. The druids ensured that no one disturbed the harmony, and those who tried to plunder their lands encountered mysterious obstacles: treacherous rocks, shifting currents, and strange echoes in the forest."

title: Ksiazka 29
txt: Page 2 - "The First Settlers"</br></br>"The druids settled the island, planting trees and enchanting the water to produce fish and plants. They built their huts amidst the forests, near springs and animal shelters, creating a place that lived in harmony with nature. They say Eldgarde has never been so peaceful."

title: Ksiazka 30
txt: Page 4 - "A Legend for Posterity"</br></br>"To this day, it is said that Eldgarde remains a druidic land-an island with a life of its own. Those who come seeking power or adventure should remember: nature rules here, and the island will never surrender easily to those who would possess it."

title: Ksiazka 31
txt: We have achieved what was impossible for others. Death is not the end. Death is a tool. The slime allows us to reverse the course of fate. Yet every being brought back through its power carries anger-anger toward the life that escaped it. If we fail to tame this force, it will tame us.

title: Ksiazka 32
txt: Page 1</br></br>We begin work on the Elixir of Life. Our goal is to bring back those who have departed. If we succeed, death will no longer be the end.

title: Ksiazka 33
txt: Page 2</br>We have begun the first trials of the elixir on dead beasts: wolves, bears, fallen creatures from the forests. Their bodies move, yet in their eyes lurks something alien, sinister. These are no longer the same creatures.

title: Ksiazka 34
txt: Page 3</br></br>The beasts movements grow unnatural. Wolves howl with voices that seem to belong to multiple beings at once. I feel that the elixir does not restore life, but fills the bodies with something else... something we should not summon.

title: Ksiazka 35
txt: Page 4</br></br>Experiments on humans reveal a terrifying truth: the elixir does not summon the souls of the departed. New entities rise, entirely alien, inhabiting the dead bodies. What we create is not a return to life it is an opening of the door for something else.

title: Ksiazka 36
txt: Page 5</br></br>The mages warn that we do not summon the dead. We create new beings that merge with dead bodies. Alien entities creep into our experiments.

title: Ksiazka 37
txt: Page 6</br></br>To confirm our suspicions, we decided to conduct an experiment on a soulless entity the Fire Devil. We must see what truly inhabits a dead body when no previous consciousness remains.

title: Ksiazka 38
txt: Page 8</br></br>The body of the Fire Devil began to change disturbingly. At one point, it split into two parts, and one transformed into a great demon. The other vanished along with its soul. Where the soul left the body, a pulsating, ominous anomaly formed.

title: Ksiazka 39
txt: Page 7</br></br>Today, the experiment with the Fire Devil. The soulless entity rose after the elixir. Its gaze... as if its true self were returning to the world from which it came, while its body remained in our laboratory.

title: Ksiazka 40
txt: Page 9</br></br>At the moment of the Fire Devil’s division, everyone present in the laboratory was filled with a strange, alien energy. Some warriors were drawn along with the demon’s soul into another world. Fortunately, a few adepts survived, but many descended into madness.

title: Ksiazka 41
txt: Page 10</br></br>The demon moved unnaturally, as if its body were trying to escape. Every movement seemed aware and alien, and the aura around it pulsed with an energy I cannot comprehend. I fear the elixir has opened something beyond our control.

title: Ksiazka 42
txt: Page 11</br></br>The Brotherhood began to fall apart. Merlidax departed toward Eldgaard, claiming he must seek the beast. Azyrion went toward the Grasslands, and Velquor went mad and allied with pirates. A few adepts survived the encounter with the demon, but most succumbed to insanity.

title: Ksiazka 43
txt: Page 12</br></br>I can no longer remain in the castle. This is my final page. All here will succumb to madness sooner or later. I leave the Zhorath Brotherhood before the darkness and energy of these experiments consume me completely.

title: Ksiazka 44
txt: Zhorath Brotherhood Journal - Notes</br></br></br>Day 1 </br></br>The experiment with the Fire Devil is over. The consequences are still uncertain. Some brothers are fascinated by its power, others remain silent and avoid conversation.</br></br></br>Day 2</br></br>The first divisions are becoming visible. The Zhorath Brotherhood wants to continue the research - they believe the Fire Devil is the key to a new era.</br>The Cautious warn of consequences. They speak of the risk of poisoning, of tainted blood.</br></br></br>Day 3</br></br>The discussions grow sharper. The Zhorath Brotherhood sits at the same table, but the atmosphere is heavy. Some see in the mixture a great gift, others  a threat.</br>Whispers arise as well not all brothers are being honest. It is said that a different substance was used in the ritual instead of Necroplasma.</br></br></br>Day 4</br></br>The first secret gatherings. The Zhorath Brotherhood meets at night near the ruins of the laboratory. The SILENT  those too afraid to speak  are beginning to disappear from the assemblies.</br>Some of them knew about the false ingredient, yet they kept quiet.</br></br></br>Day 5</br></br>The Zhorath Brotherhood is no longer truly united. There is no open hostility yet, but everyone can see that something has broken. The Fire Devil did not only ignite flames  it tore us apart.</br>The mystery of the substance has not yet been revealed, and suspicions continue to grow.

title: Ksiazka 45
txt: The soul of the summoned beast was not unified - torn into many voices that still echo through the halls. Screams, whispers, wails - each different, yet all belonged to the same being. The brothers cannot comprehend how something like this can exist.</br></br>The most disturbing event involved Sorin. He had always been the bravest knight of the Zhorath Brotherhood  first into battle, never retreating from fire or blade. Yet during the ritual, when the beast opened the portal, his axe was ripped from his hands and pulled into the abyss.</br>Sorin  instead of fighting  fled in panic. He did not even attempt to resist.</br></br>The sight shook everyone. If even he broke before the beast, what hope is there for the rest of us?  Beast has not only torn our ranks  it has begun to tear our very souls.

title: Ksiazka 46
txt: I checked the condition of our ritual supporting artifacts  Might Rings and Stone Skin Amulets. Many of them show signs of wear: weakened energies, cracks in their magical structure. Some work only partially, and their power diminishes with prolonged use.</br></br>From experience, it is clear that in the upcoming rituals we will need far more of these items. The current supply will not be sufficient if we want to ensure the potion’s effectiveness and the safety of the experiment participants.

title: Ksiazka 47
txt:
Page 2  "The Old Miner's Notes"

"No one knows where it came from. It appeared after the sudden collapse of one of the mines, as if awakening from a darkness that had long lingered underground. Those who have seen it claim its tentacles are longer than a human body, and its venom paralyzes anything within its reach."

title: Ksiazka 48
txt: When the giants' ship crashed against the rocks, the lighthouse's flame extinguished, never to return. Since then, no ship has been able to reach the lighthouse as if the depths themselves barred access to its ruins.

title: Ksiazka 49
txt: The first to see the Kraken was a young sailor named Kaldvorn. It is said that his scream was heard even in Rookgaard, and the boat he was on broke into pieces in an instant.

title: Ksiazka 50
txt: Some druids attempted to reach the lighthouse by walking along the ocean floor with ancient breath spells. But the sea seemed to oppose their steps wave after wave washed away their traces, and those who returned spoke only of the shadows of tentacled shapes and a silence that was more oppressive than the water itself.

title: Ksiazka 51
txt: They say the monster was born from the sea's anger. When humans built the first boats and began taking the fish that belonged to the ocean, the depths responded with a beast with tentacles as long as masts and eyes as red as the embers of a furnace.

title: Ksiazka 52
txt: Fishermen tell of the Dredfin a sea beast with a mouth full of teeth as long as swords and a fin that can sink a boat with a single blow. It has been seen dragging in entire nets, and the waves in its wake look like plowed fields. But they also whisper something else that the Dredfin isn't the greatest terror of these waters. Something older and darker watches in the depths, waiting for the day when the lighthouse will go out again.
